content:
Diagnosis:	Left breast cancer - T1cN0M0 claudin-low carcinoma

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
		1 Feb 2024 - 15 Mar 2024 Adjuvant radiotherapy

Histology:	Grade 2 claudin-low carcinoma, 18mm, clear margins >5mm
		ER 7/8, PR 6/8, HER2 negative (1+)
		0/2 sentinel nodes involved

Current Situation:	End of treatment review

I reviewed [redacted name] following completion of adjuvant radiotherapy to the left breast. She has tolerated the treatment well with only grade 1 skin reaction which is now resolving. There is mild breast tenderness but no concerning symptoms. Her energy levels are improving and she has returned to work part-time.

On examination, there is expected post-radiation change in the left breast with mild erythema and no concerning features. The surgical scar is well-healed. No lymphadenopathy.

I have discussed the treatment completion and ongoing hormone therapy plan. She will start tamoxifen 20mg daily from next week. I have provided written information about side effects and encouraged her to contact the breast care nurses if needed.

The plan is for annual mammogram surveillance and clinical review in 6 months. She understands to report any new concerning symptoms.

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
Completed course of adjuvant radiotherapy to left breast

patient_facts.value: Expected post-radiation change in left breast with mild erythema, well-healed surgical scar, no lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: Early stage left breast cancer completed primary surgery and radiotherapy with good tolerance. Starting adjuvant hormone therapy.
Grade 1 skin reaction from radiotherapy, now resolving
